contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox kommune | name = Søndre Land | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 0536 | image_skyline = Hov i Land, Søndre Land.jpg | county = Oppland | district = Land, Norway | capital = [[Hov, Norway|Hov]] | language = [[Bokmål]] | demonym = Søndrelending | coatofarms = Sondre Land komm.png | munwebpage = www.sondre-land.kommune.no | mayor = Reidar Eriksen | mayor_party = ''Søndre Land Bygdeliste'' | mayor_as_of = 2003 | area_rank = 150 | area_total_km2 = 728 | area_land_km2 = 659 | area_water_percent = 0.22 | population_as_of = 2004 | population_rank = 165 | population_total = 6042 | populationpercent = 0.13 | population_density_km2= 9 | population_increase= -3.7 | latd = 60 | latm = 40 | lats = 37 | longd = 10 | longm = 16 | longs = 44 | utm_zone = 32V | utm_northing = 6727503 | utm_easting = 0569882 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} '''Søndre Land''' is a [[Municipalities of Norway|municipality]] in [[Oppland]] [[Counties of Norway|county]], [[Norway]]. It is part of the [[Districts of Norway|traditional region]] of [[Land, Norway|Land]]. The administrative centre of the municipality is the village of [[Hov, Norway|Hov]]. [[File:Odnes (Søndre Land, Norway) - Lindahl.jpg|thumb|left|190px|Odnes Hotel (c.1880-1890)]] The old municipality of [[Land, Norway|Land]] was divided into ''Søndre Land'' and ''[[Nordre Land]]'' in 1847. The area of [[Fluberg]] was separated from Søndre Land to become a separate municipality on 1 January 1914, but it was merged back into Søndre Land on 1 January 1962. ==General information== ===Name=== The [[Old Norse]] form of the name was just ''Land'' which means "[[Earth|land]]". Therefore, the meaning of the name ''Søndre Land'' is "(the) southern (part of) Land". The [[parish]] and municipality of Land was divided in 1847.<ref>{{cite book|title=Norske gaardnavne: Kristians amt (Anden halvdel)|edition=4|authorlink=Oluf Rygh|last=Rygh|first=Oluf|publisher=W. C. Fabritius & sønners bogtrikkeri|date=1900|location=Kristiania, Norge|pages=179|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=jJMOAAAAYAAJ}} {{no icon}}</ref> {{See also|Nordre Land}} ===Coat-of-arms=== The [[Coat of arms|coat-of-arms]] is from modern times. They were granted on 21 June 1985. The arms show three yellow [[Trunk (botany)|tree trunks]] on a blue background. The blue colour of the shield symbolises the [[Randsfjorden]], which borders the municipality. The tree trunks symbolise the importance of [[forestry]] and the [[sawmill]]s in the municipality.<ref>{{cite web|author=Norske Kommunevåpen|date=1990|title=Nye kommunevåbener i Norden|url=http://www.ngw.nl/int/nor/s/sondrela.htm|accessdate=2009-01-01}}</ref> [[Image:Fluberg-Dokka-Norway-HH.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Fluberg]] {{See also2|Coats-of-arms of [[Nes, Akershus|Nes]] and [[Stokke]]}} ==Geography== Søndre Land is bordered on the north by the municipality of [[Nordre Land]], on the east by [[Gjøvik]] and [[Vestre Toten]], on the west by [[Sør-Aurdal]], and on the south by [[Gran, Norway|Gran]] in Oppland county. It is also bordered to the west by [[Ringerike]] in [[Buskerud]] county. Søndre Land is {{convert|39.2|km|mi}} on a north-south axis and {{convert|31.3|km|mi}} east-west. It lies in the south of Oppland and on the northern end of [[Randsfjord]]. The highest elevation is Skjellinghovde with a height of {{convert|856|m|ft}}. The main population centers include Holmen and Hov. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{commonscat-inline|Søndre Land}} *{{wti|Søndre Land}} *[http://www.ssb.no/english/municipalities/0536 Municipal fact sheet] from [[Statistics Norway]] *{{Wikivoyage-inline|Oppland}} {{Oppland}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sondre Land}} [[Category:Municipalities of Oppland]] [[Category:Land, Norway]] [[Category:Søndre Land| ]]
